eng: Tom is taking baby steps.
How many eggs are there in the fridge?
I'm too busy to see Tom.
kor: 나는 너무 바빠서 톰을 못 봐.

eng: A human body consists of a countless number of cells.
kor: 인간의 몸은 수많은 세포들로 구성되어 있어.

eng: Tom says you're lonely.
Here comes our teacher.
Tom is having a hard time swallowing.
kor: 톰은 삼키는 데 어려움을 겪고 있어.

eng: I can't believe Tom confessed.
kor: 나는 톰이 자백했다는 것을 믿을 수 없다.

eng: I know you hate school.
kor: 네가 학교를 싫어한다는 건 알고 있어.

eng: I hope that we don't have to wait for too long.

kor: 그 사람은 집에 아주 늦게 왔어.

eng: Have you ever studied archeology?

kor: 이건 톰이 가장 좋아하는 프랑스 단어야.

eng: Tom said Mary was overweight.
I know Tom is afraid of spiders.
kor: 난 톰이 거미를 무서워한다는 걸 알고 있어.

eng: I learned how to cook from Tom.
Tom and Mary do as they're told.
kor: 톰이랑 메리는 자기들이 말한 대로 하고 있어.

eng: I thought that I heard you coughing.
kor: 네가 기침한 소리를 들은 줄 알았어.

eng: Do you really think you can convince Tom to do that?
kor: 너 정말 톰이 그걸 하도록 설득할 수 있다고 생각해?

eng: Am I talking too much?
kor: 내가 너무 말을 많이 하고 있어?

eng: Tom used soap and water to wash his hands.
kor: 톰은 손을 씻으려고 비누랑 물을 썼다.

eng: I assured Tom that I wouldn't do that.
kor: 난 톰한테 내가 안 그럴 거라고 단언했어.

eng: Humans can't live without air.
kor: 인간은 공기 없인 살 수 없어.

eng: His face was red.
Tom asked for a discount.
Why do you hate women?
Tom is a pretty good poet.
The fact Tom did that can't be denied.
kor: 톰이 그걸 했다는 사실은 부인할 수 없는 사실이야.

eng: Tom prevented Mary from doing that.
kor: 톰은 메리가 그걸 못 하도록 막았어.

eng: I don't believe Tom is a murderer.
What do you remember about last night?
Why are you still working?
Are you really thinking about getting married?
I like Korean cuisine.
I wish that I could've helped Tom more.

eng: When does your winter vacation begin?
I hope that this is the beginning of a beautiful friendship.
I'm not sure what it was, but it sounded like a gunshot.
kor: 그것이 무엇이었는지는 확신할 수는 없지만, 그것은 총소리처럼 들렸다.

eng: I hope Tom knows what to say.
kor: 톰이 어떤 말을 해야할지 알고있길 바라.

eng: Who taught you that?
Women are often judged by their looks.
We are both in the same class.
I didn't think Tom knew how to drive.
kor: 난 톰이 운전하는 법을 안다는 걸 몰랐어.

eng: Am I older than you?
I'm sure Tom is going to be there.
I don't want to study medicine.
The gift was still wrapped.
I think that we're still too young.
kor: 우린 아직 너무 어린 것 같아.

eng: Tom looks old for his age.

kor: 어디서 서핑하는 법을 배울 수 있어?

eng: Tom baked three pies.

kor: 톰이 네가 이걸 하는 걸 본다면 울게 될 걸.

eng: Is that why they died?
I'm happiest when I'm singing.
kor: 난 노래 부르고 있을 때가 가장 행복해.

eng: I think Tom and Mary are right.
kor: 난 톰과 메리가 맞는 것 같다.

eng: Tom made Mary mad.
Can I borrow your scissors?

Women like men with mustaches.

Tom is going to be there tonight.
I want to be able to play the violin as well as Tom.

eng: I'm seeing a trend here.
You should study French.
kor: 넌 프랑스어를 공부해야 할 것 같아.

eng: I shook Tom awake.
Tom said that what you told me wasn't true.
kor: 톰은 네가 나에게 말한것은 사실이 아니라고 말했다.

eng: My daughter is still quite young.
I have some English books.
I believe that the answer is straightforward.
Tom thinks that Mary is lonely.
Learning a musical instrument trains the mind.
kor: 악기를 배우는 건 정신을 훈련시킬 수 있어.

eng: We don't lie.
It is difficult to convey the meaning exactly.
I eat meat almost every day.
Tom was three when his mother was killed in a traffic accident.
kor: 톰은 어머님이 교통사고로 돌아가셨을 때 세 살이었어.

eng: I hope you have insurance.
We've been here since October.
Tom and Mary became very good friends.
kor: 톰과 메리는 아주 좋은 친구가 되었다더라.

eng: You're persistent, aren't you?
Tom seems to be worried about something.
kor: 톰은 뭔가를 걱정하는 것 처럼 보여.

eng: I know I'm going to learn a lot.
kor: 내가 많이 배우게 될 거라는 걸 알고 있어.

eng: I wonder if Tom is still unemployed.
It's been nice talking to you, but I really must go now.
kor: 너와 이야기 하는 것은 정말 좋았는데, 근데 진짜 가봐야 해.

eng: Tom was totally into it.
kor: 탐은 그 것에 푹 빠져 있었다.

eng: We want you to sing the song.
kor: 우리는 네가 그 노래를 불렀으면 좋겠다.

eng: I should've cooked the pork longer.

kor: 네가 나중에 후회할 만한 말은 하지마.

eng: Tom was the one who wrote this story.

Why do I always get up at this time?
kor: 나는 왜 항상 이 시간에 일어날까?

eng: That's my favorite expression.
kor: 이게 바로 내가 가장 좋아하는 표현이야.

eng: Don't put your hands out the window.

kor: 네가 아직 만난 적 없는 여자애들도 여기 있어?

eng: Tom has been crying every night.
Tom loves to study music.
Tom is having a hard time.
Is there something that you wish to tell me?
Police are trained to use weapons.
kor: 경찰은 총을 쓸 수 있도록 훈련받았어.

eng: Tom and John pretended to be brothers.
Who woke Tom up this morning?
Tom walked towards the stairs.
Tom doesn't eat any fish except canned tuna.
kor: 톰은 참치통조림 이외의 생선류는 절대 먹지 않아.

eng: Tom seems to be very lonely.
Tom found out what went wrong.
The police believe Tom acted alone.
kor: 경찰은 톰이 혼자인 척 했다고 믿고 있어.

eng: We don't know whether Tom can come or not.
kor: 우리는 톰이 올수 있을지 없을지 모릅니다.

eng: Tom didn't tell Mary why he had to work late.
kor: 톰은 메리에게 왜 그가 늦게까지 일해야 했는지 알려주지 않았다.

eng: I spent two hours reading a book last night.
kor: 나는 어젯밤에 책을 읽느라 두 시간을 보냈어.

eng: Actinium melts at 1,051°C.
You're very astute.
I really like snow.
Foxes are my favorite animal.

Your cat scratched me.

I should've never trusted Tom.
I've been kidnapped.
Tom is reading a magazine.
Could you make sure Tom is OK?

eng: I may be too old.
This isn't a French word.

Tom is ashamed of his body.
Astronomy is by no means a new science.
Will Tom come with his wife, or alone?

eng: He kept me waiting.

I want Tom to go to Australia to visit his uncle.
kor: 난 톰이 삼촌네에 방문하러 호주에 갔으면 좋겠어.

eng: I know that Tom is a very good chess player.
kor: 나는 톰이 체스를 아주 잘 둔다는 것을 알고 있어.

eng: Can the matter wait till tomorrow?
When should I do that?
I want Tom to help me clean the house.
He won't let anybody sit in his armchair.
kor: 그는 아무도 그의 안락의자에 못 앉게 할 것이다.

eng: Tom wasn't in when I dropped by.
I don't like Boston as much as I used to.
He stopped smoking last year.

Tom isn't here, I assure you.
I wasn't comfortable with the situation.
I wish I could remember everything Tom told me.

eng: Why are you acting so childish?

Tom said that Mary was autistic.
Help yourself to anything you'd like to eat.
I've read your book. It was very interesting.
I'm looking for a hat to match a brown dress.

eng: That's why I've done all this.
kor: 그게 내가 이 모든 것을 한 이유이다.

eng: Tom sat down by the fire.

We have a white cat.
I think the mistake is mine.
Tom slammed down the phone.

kor: 톰은 메리와 존이 말하는 것을 들으며 창문 밖에 서 있었다.

eng: It's not as difficult as you think.
kor: 그건 네가 생각하는 만큼 어려운 건 아냐.

eng: Not all of my cats are gray.

Tom is better at French than I am.
I hate my voice.

eng: They made fun of Mary.

I tried to act cool.

I only did the bare minimum.

eng: I knew that Tom didn't want to do that again.

eng: I like learning ancient languages.
kor: 난 고대 언어를 배우는 걸 좋아해.

eng: Tom is relatively fit and healthy.

kor: 내가 너한테 보낸 꽃 마음에 들었어?

I feel like this isn't going to end well.
kor: 좋게 끝날 것 같지 않은 기분이야.

eng: Tell me I'm not dreaming.

eng: Tom was three years old when his mother was killed in a traffic accident.

eng: I'm way stronger than I used to be.

I think French is the most beautiful language in the world.

eng: I think that what you're doing is wrong.

eng: I never should've borrowed money from Tom.

eng: Tom sleeps all the time.

kor: 모든 말들이 동등하게 태어난 건 아니야. 몇몇은 이기기 위해 태어났어.

I want to learn Chinese next year.

eng: Tom left us some food and water.

eng: The following morning, the snowman was completely melted.

I really hate myself right now.

eng: I try to act appropriately.

kor: 이 책 세 권은 톰 거야.

eng: He's in his fifties.

eng: The tire factory employs 250 people.

kor: 우리는 톰의 도움없이 이것을 할 수 있다.

eng: My daughter is not yet three.

eng: Tom has been battling depression for many years.

eng: You can learn French.

kor: 톰은 게으른 아이가 아니야. 실제로는 열심히 해.

My father is suffering from influenza.

kor: 톰은 좀 소심한 것 같지 않아?

eng: I'm aware this is Monday.

kor: 가장 최근에 카누를 탄 적이 언제야?

eng: Tom was probably pondering something.

eng: No one listens anymore.
My wife is wearing a blue dress.
kor: 내 아내는 파란 드레스를 입고 있어.

eng: Every time I read this novel, I find it very interesting.

eng: I'm a patient man.
I don't like this store.
It looks like it's going to rain.
Learning French takes time.
Could you tell me what that means?
kor: 그게 뭘 의미하는 건지 말해줄 수 있을까?

eng: Tom eats meat, but Mary doesn't.
kor: 톰은 마리와는 달리 고기를 먹을 수 있어.

eng: Tom is allowed to stay. The rest of you have to leave.
kor: 톰은 남아 있어도 돼. 너희 나머지는 나가야 해.

Tom is having a tough time.

eng: We never should've gone to Australia.

eng: Tom wouldn't let them in.
kor: 톰은 그들을 못 들어 오게 했다.

eng: Tom didn't get up early.

kor: 운에 맡길 수 없는 것들이 있다.

eng: Have you talked to the doctors yet?

kor: 아직은 많은 것을 말해 줄 수는 없어.

eng: Have you ever seen Tom laugh?
kor: 톰이 웃은 걸 한번이라도 본 적 있어?

eng: Tom was afraid to be here.

kor: 나는 네 고양이가 좋은데, 네 고양이는 나를 싫어하네.

eng: I like learning languages.
I want to learn guitar.
I should've told you everything earlier.
kor: 너한테 모든 걸 좀 더 빨리 얘기했어야 했는데.

eng: She dyed her hair blonde.

I was happy to help you.
I haven't heard from anyone.

eng: Tom climbed the mountain.

kor: 이 길이 어디로 가는지 알려 줄래?

eng: Tom filled the bathtub with warm water.

kor: 그게 네가 하고 싶은 말 전부니?

eng: This soup is too salty.

eng: How about stopping the car and taking a rest?

eng: Now we have one less thing to worry about.

eng: Is there something that you wish to tell me?

Tom is going home now.
I hate myself for hating Tom.

eng: Don't you want to go with me?

I should've bought more food.
kor: 내가 먹을 것을 더 샀어야 했는데.

eng: He tried to open the door.

kor: 이 문장이 무슨 뜻인 것 같아?

eng: Tom finally found his keys.

kor: 톰은 내가 마치 집에 있는 것처럼 편안하게 해주었어.

eng: I wonder why Tom left.

Does anyone oppose the new plan?
If your father asks your mother a question in French, does she answer in French or in English?
kor: 너의 아버지가 어머니에게 만약 프랑스어로 질문을 하면 그녀는 프랑스어로 대답하니 아니면 영어로 대답하니?

eng: Tom's dog is very big.
Tom is a pretty good poet.
Tom came here to learn French.
This information is very important to us.
kor: 이 정보는 우리한테 있어서 정말 중요해요.

eng: Where did you learn to make pizza?
I wanted to see Tom's room.
I can't answer your question.
kor: 나는 네 질문에 답할 수 없어.

eng: Tom has kids now.
Can you help me?
Our new car is not very big.
kor: 우리의 새 차는 그렇게 크지는 않다.

eng: I live in a small apartment.
I didn't know Tom was a drug addict.
kor: 난 톰이 마약 중독자라는 걸 몰랐어.

eng: How long do you plan to stay there?
The earth is much larger than the moon.
I need to warn Tom.
Tom wore jeans and a cowboy hat.
kor: 톰은 청바지를 입고 카우보이 모자를 썼어.

eng: Tom's boss was really angry.
I'm not going to go in there.
Is it true that you're a high school teacher?
Tom has three computers.
kor: 톰은 컴퓨터를 세 대 가지고 있어.

eng: Upon hearing the news, she broke down crying.
kor: 그녀는 그 소식을 듣자마자 울음을 터뜨렸다.

eng: This news is important to us.
Tom is our next-door neighbor.
This grocery store only sells organic food.
kor: 이 슈퍼마켓에선 오직 유기농 음식만 팔아.

eng: Don't believe everything people tell you.
I can't ask Tom right now.
kor: 난 지금 당장은 톰한테 물어볼 수 없어.

eng: I'm sorry that you had to hear that.
I wanted Tom to sing my favorite song.
kor: 난 톰이 내가 좋아하는 노래를 불러줬으면 했어.

eng: I like studying languages.
Come to my house whenever you like.
I wish I'd married another man.
You and I have a lot in common.
I know Tom is a very good chess player.
kor: 나는 톰이 체스를 아주 잘 둔다는 것을 알고 있어.

eng: I managed to crack the code.
That's just my guess.
Where in the world have you been?
Nobody backed up what I said.
I feel very guilty.
Working in such conditions was especially difficult.
kor: 저런 상태에서 일하는 것은 특히 어려운 일이었다.

eng: The students of this school are kind.
Tom is a very bad person.
I can't decode the message.
I hope that I can do it.
Are you really willing to help?
Tom kicked the ball really hard.
The police believe that Tom acted alone.
kor: 경찰은 톰이 혼자인 척 했던 것이라고 믿고 있어.

eng: Do you still live where you used to?
kor: 너 아직도 전에 살았던 곳에 살아?

eng: Tom started getting mad.
Have you eaten dinner yet?
That's my main focus.
You may use my computer if you want to.
kor: 내 컴퓨터 쓰고 싶으면 써도 돼.

eng: I used to do that every day.
When was the last time you saw that cat?
kor: 저 고양이를 마지막으로 봤을 때가 언제야?

eng: Your advice has been very helpful.
Language changes as human beings do.
I don't like Tom anymore.
kor: 나는 톰을 더 이상 안 좋아해.

eng: I ordered five books on economics from London.
kor: 나는 경제학 책을 다섯권 런던에 주문했다.

eng: I have nothing to lose.
I wanted to spend time with my children.
kor: 난 내 아이들과 시간을 보내고 싶었어.

eng: I'm looking forward to traveling with Tom.
kor: 나는 톰과 같이 여행하기를 기대하고 있다.

eng: Tom works for a tech company.
The dog stopped barking.
He is in his library.
I like to travel alone.
Tom and Mary said they were on our side.
You need good equipment to climb that mountain.
kor: 저 산에 오르려면 좋은 장비가 있어야 돼.

eng: Have you ever been stuck in an elevator?
Only four horses competed in the race.
kor: 오직 네 마리 말만 경주에 참가했어.

eng: This building has a green roof.
This is a complete distortion of the facts.
Thousands of people died during the plague.
Tom is smoking a cigar.
This word isn't French.
Tom is eating potato chips.
Tom wondered what Mary wanted to do.
The gravity of the moon is one-sixth of that of the earth.
I'm the only one who can do that.
kor: 내가 그걸 할 수 있는 유일한 사람이군.

eng: You can't force yourself to forget something.
kor: 기억을 억지로 잊게 할 수는 없어.

eng: I watched Tom eat.
I take back what I said.
How many children were injured?
All participants will receive a T-shirt.
I don't want to celebrate my birthday.
kor: 난 내 생일을 축하하고 싶지 않다.

eng: Do you still suffer from headaches?
I felt sad for no reason.
I'm sorry, but there's no other way.
kor: 미안하지만, 이거 말곤 다른 방법이 없어.

eng: Men like to look masculine.
This bread looks delicious.
Tom isn't a good manager.
You're quite forgetful.
I want to meet Tom's parents.
What are their true intentions?
kor: 그 사람들의 실제 무슨 속셈인 거야?

eng: Someone stole my watch.
I really appreciate all your help.
Is there something that you want to say?
A blood vessel burst inside his brain.
kor: 그 사람의 뇌 안에 혈관이 터졌어.

eng: Tom certainly thinks so.
To be honest with you, I don't think I can do that.
kor: 솔칙히 말하면 나는 내가 할 수 있을거란 자신이 없어.

eng: This magnet is very powerful.
I am very concerned about his health.
kor: 난 그 사람의 건강이 너무 걱정돼.

eng: Tom spends most of his time sitting on the porch.
kor: 톰은 대부분의 시간을 현관에 앉는 걸로 보내고 있어.

eng: I had difficulty in solving this problem.
kor: 이 문제를 해결하는 데 곤욕을 겪고 있다

eng: Try to see the problem from her point of view.
kor: 그 사람의 관점으로 문제를 보려고 노력하자.

eng: I recognize those people.
Tom wants to learn how to play piano.
kor: 톰은 피아노 치는 법을 배우고 싶어해.

eng: What language do they speak in your country?
We'll be right here.
Tom swims well for his age.
Tom sat two rows ahead of me.
If I were you, I'd call a doctor.
kor: 내가 만약 너라면 의사를 부를 텐데.

eng: Tom was afraid to be here.
Tom has some experience in teaching French.
That's all I'm doing.
I don't care what you thought.
kor: 네가 생각한 바에 난 개의치 않는다.

eng: Your hand is shaking.
Tom wondered why there was a dog in his house.
kor: 톰은 왜 자기 집에 개가 있었는지 알고 싶었다.

eng: Tom usually drinks beer at parties.
We were in Australia last week.
Things are the same, but people have changed.
God is always watching over us.
I don't play the piano as often as I used to.
kor: 나는 피아노를 예전만큼 자주는 안 쳐.

eng: Somebody was talking to Tom.
What convinced you to change your mind?
What's your Skype username?
I didn't know you used to teach French.
I know Tom is a lazy kid.
kor: 난 톰이 게으른 애라는 걸 알고 있어.

eng: Tell me what's going on.
It's really hard to stop.
I asked Tom why he wanted to study French.
kor: 나는 톰에게 왜 프랑스어를 배우고자했는지 물어봤다.

eng: I'll never tell you.
kor: 나는 결코 너에게 말하지 않을 것이다.

eng: You, too, can learn French.
kor: 너도 마찬가지로 프랑스어를 배울 수 있어.

eng: Tom may use my video camera if he wants to.
kor: 톰이 원한다면, 내 비디오 카메라를 쓸 수 있다.

eng: Is there anything you want to tell me?
Nothing seems to grow in this soil.
kor: 이 흙에서는 아무것도 자라지 않는 것으로 보인다.

eng: He can speak and write French.
kor: 그는 불어로 말하고 쓸 수 있다.

eng: I dreamed I kissed Tom.
Tom wouldn't let them in.
kor: 톰은 그들을 못 들어 가게 했다.

eng: Tom kicked the ball really hard.
Are you enjoying your weekend?
Having been convicted of murder, he was sentenced to life imprisonment.
You are not a good person. You know that, right?
kor: 넌 그다지 좋은 사람이 아냐. 너도 그건 알고 있지?

eng: We shouldn't've given up.
I had to wait 20 minutes on the phone before reaching the customer service rep.
kor: 통화해서 고객 서비스 상담원에게 말하기 전까지 연결 대기 큐에서 20분이나 기다렸어야 했어.

eng: Tom is married to a Canadian named Mary.
I think that Tom is distinguished.
Tom roasted the marshmallow over the fire.
I sent Tom a text.
Tom wakes up at six-thirty every morning.
kor: 톰은 아침마다 여섯 시 삼십 분에 일어나.

eng: To tell the truth, he is not a human being.
I don't like cafeteria food very much.
kor: 난 식당 음식을 그다지 좋아하지 않아.

eng: Tom is swimming in the neighbor's pool.
Tom hasn't finished his homework yet.
Did Tom tell you what to do?
kor: 톰이 네게 뭘 해야 할지를 말해줬니?

eng: I thought that Tom didn't like cats.
kor: 난 톰이 고양이를 싫어하는 줄 알았어.

eng: We're still eating.
How long will you be staying there?
I really love French books.
Are these yours, Tom?
He came down to breakfast.
Have you ever seen Tom not wearing glasses?
kor: 톰이 안경 벗은 거 본 적 있어?

eng: If it is worth doing at all, it is worth doing well.
kor: 할 가치가 있는 일이면, 제대로 하십시오.

eng: How long can a person live without water?
kor: 사람은 물 없이 얼마나 살 수 있어?

eng: If it were not for water, human life would be impossible.
kor: 물이 없었다면 인류의 생존은 가능하지 않았을 겁니다.

eng: What in the world do you think you're doing?
kor: 세상에 네가 뭘 하고 있다고 생각하는 거니?

eng: No one recognized me.
